headline.main: DrChrono Raises $2.8 Million to Digitize Doctor's Visits

docs.abstract: A start-up in Silicon Valley is hoping to streamline and simplify the process of seeing a doctor with a suite of applications aimed at both physicians and patients. It is gaining customers, and raising money.
docs.snippet: A start-up in Silicon Valley is hoping to streamline and simplify the process of seeing a doctor with a suite of applications aimed at both physicians and patients. It is gaining customers, and raising money.

docs.lead_paragraph: Anyone who has ever spent any amount of time shuttling between doctors' offices for medical treatment knows how difficult it is to stay on top of all the diagnoses, treatments, recommendations and prescriptions between visits.

headline.main: DrChrono Raises $2.8 Million to Digitize Doctor's Visits

docs.lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta has outlined a strategy guiding hundreds of billions of dollars in Pentagon budget cuts. Here’s how more than 12,000 readers chose to solve an interactive puzzle with the same goals.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite a rash of recent injuries to some of their top rivals, the freestyle snowmobiling competitors gathered in Aspen, Colo., still plan to try their riskiest stunts.

headline.seo: X Games Snowmobilers Shrug Off Injury Risks
headline.main: X Games Snowmobilers Shrug Off Injury Concerns
headline.print_headline: X Games Snowmobilers Shrug Off Injury Concerns

docs.abstract: Freestyle snowmobiling competitors are gathering in Aspen, Colo, and still plan to try their riskiest stunts at the Winter X games, despite a rash of recent injuries to some of their top rivals.
docs.snippet: Despite a rash of recent injuries to some of their top rivals, the freestyle snowmobiling competitors gathered in Aspen, Colo., still plan to try their riskiest stunts.

docs.abstract: If Mitt Romney lived in France, Germany or Britain — the heart of what he calls “the European-style welfare state” — one thing is for sure: he’d be paying more taxes.
docs.snippet: If Mitt Romney lived in France, Germany or Britain — the heart of what he calls “the European-style welfare state” — one thing is for sure: he’d be paying more taxes.

byline.original: By DAVID JOLLY and TOM REDBURN

docs.lead_paragraph: 5:46 p.m. | Updated to correct income figure for Liliane Bettencourt.
docs.abstract: Estimating how much more in taxes Mitt Romney's income would have incurred in France, Germany and Britain - the heart of what he calls "the European-style welfare state."
docs.snippet: Estimating how much more in taxes Mitt Romney's income would have incurred in France, Germany and Britain - the heart of what he calls "the European-style welfare state."

docs.lead_paragraph: The transcript of President Obama’s State of the Union address.

headline.seo: State of the Union Address — 2012 — Transcript
headline.main: President Obama’s State of the Union Address

docs.snippet: The transcript of President Obama’s State of the Union address.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the 21st-century economy, everyone is going to have to find a little something extra to stand out in their field of employment.
docs.abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column asserts advances in both globalization and information technology are keeping unemployment high by replacing labor with machines or foreign workers; points out, since best jobs will to go to workers with a better education, best way to combat unemployment is to ensure that every American has access to post-high school education.
docs.snippet: In the 21st-century economy, everyone is going to have to find a little something extra to stand out in their field of employment.

docs.lead_paragraph: With the president in re-election mode, his State of the Union address highlighted how his tactics in dealing with Congress have changed, even if his policy goals have not.

headline.seo: State of the Union? More Like State of the Campaign

docs.lead_paragraph: A proposed change to depression’s definition could greatly expand the number of people treated, a new study says.

headline.seo: Depression’s Criteria May Be Changed to Include Grieving
headline.main: Grief Could Join List of Disorders
headline.print_headline: Grief Could Join List Of Disorders

docs.abstract: Report issued by psychiatric researchers at Columbia and New York Universities argues that a proposed change to the definition of depression would characterize grieving as a disorder and could greatly increase the number of people who are treated unnecessarily for depression; the change has been proposed for the American Psychiatric Association's fifth edition of its Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders.
docs.snippet: A proposed change to depression’s definition could greatly expand the number of people treated, a new study says.
